capabilities.tldr: Develop once, be on all platforms and devices.
capabilities.for: Especially content heavy apps and sites that want to maximize distribution.
data: Netflix uses web technologies to bring its app to almost every platform imaginable.

capabilities.tldr: Deep indexing of your content opens entry points from search engines.
capabilities.for: Everything content and keyword-heavy, featuring lots of sub pages.
data: Wikipedia has 38x mobile traffic to web over app

capabilities.tldr: Web apps and sites are remotely hosted and up to date by default, for 100% of your visitors.
capabilities.for: News sites, highly dynamic games with large user bases that need constant updates, everything that needs to stay fresh, for everyone, at all times.

capabilities.tldr: The web can deliver apps and sites that are preloaded in less than a second.
capabilities.for: Any apps and sites that are short-lived (per visit) in nature. People will wait for a long game, but not for an utility app (i.e. displaying the weather).

capabilities.tldr: The web does not censor content or disallow different payment providers and is an even playing field for all.
capabilities.for: Adult entertainment, file sharing or gambling apps, apps that want to choose a different payment provider than the OS default.

capabilities.tldr: Clicking on a link is effortless compared to installing a native app.
capabilities.for: Apps that are rarely used, apps that need to be tried first, apps that seem risky to install.
data: 20% of native apps are used only once.
75% of time is spent in the top four native apps.

capabilities.tldr: The web has the best sharing mechanism in the world, built in.
capabilities.for: Social games and other apps that can utilize sharing as part of the functionality. Any app that distributes best through word of mouth.

capabilities.tldr: Your web app will still run 20 years from now, even if you abandon its development.
data: The Space Jam promotion site, built in 1996, is still alive and kicking!
